documentType: bureau of prisons count sheet / inmate roster
summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons count sheet and inmate roster from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 9-10, 2019. It records inmate counts by housing unit and includes a specific roster showing inmate assignments, including one for 'SUICIDE OR' watch. This is significant as it is from the facility and timeframe where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

persons.name: Bullock
persons.context: Listed as an inmate on the MCC roster under assignment 'HOSP' with a 'SUICIDE OR' watch designation.

persons.name: Decapua
persons.context: Listed as an inmate on the MCC roster with a 'SUICIDE OR' watch designation.

events.title: Inmate Roster and Suicide Watch Assignments
events.description: An inmate roster from MCC New York shows four inmates (Bullock, Decapua, Gama-Pineda, McDuffie) assigned to 'SUICIDE OR' watch status.

events.title: Official Inmate Count at MCC New York
events.description: A Bureau of Prisons count sheet records an official inmate census of 758 individuals across various housing units at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, NY
keyFacts: The document is a Bureau of Prisons count sheet and inmate roster from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York dated August 9-10, 2019.
An inmate roster shows four individuals (Bullock, Decapua, Gama-Pineda, McDuffie) were on 'SUICIDE OR' watch assignment on August 9, 2019.
An official inmate count on August 10, 2019, recorded a total census of 758 inmates at the MCC.
The document is procedural, showing standard prison operations for tracking inmate location and special status (like suicide watch) at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
The document does not mention Jeffrey Epstein by name, but originates from the facility and timeframe central to the investigation into his death.
